summary:
Australia, also known as Sahul, is a continent in the Southern and Eastern hemispheres. It includes Australia, Tasmania, New Guinea, and nearby islands. During the ice age, these were all connected by land. The continent is small, flat, and dry, with a large continental shelf.

Australia, the country, is the largest landmass and has a strong economy, high human development, and a diverse population, including many immigrants. Papua New Guinea, also part of the continent, is very rural and has many unique cultures and languages.
title: Australia (continent)
